definitions.definition: having or emitting a clear resonant sound.

examples: the Russian leader received a ringing declaration of support

definitions.definition: surround (someone or something), especially for protection or containment.
examples: the courthouse was ringed with police

definitions.definition: form a line around the edge of (something circular).
draw a circle around (something), especially to focus attention on it.
examples: an area of Tribeca had been ringed in red

definitions.definition: put a circular band through the nose of (a bull, pig, or other farm animal) to lead or otherwise control it.
make a clear resonant or vibrating sound.
synonyms: tinkle; literaryknell "church bells rang all day"

definitions.definition: cause (a bell or alarm) to ring.
examples: he walked up to the door and rang the bell

definitions.definition: (of a telephone) produce a series of resonant or vibrating sounds to signal an incoming call.
examples: the phone rang again as I replaced it

definitions.definition: call for service or attention by sounding a bell.
examples: Ruth, will you ring for some tea?

definitions.definition: sound (the hour, a peal, etc.) on a bell or bells.
(of a place) resound or reverberate with (a sound or sounds).
(of a person's ears) be filled with a continuous buzzing or humming sound, especially as the aftereffect of a blow or loud noise.
examples: he yelled so loudly that my eardrums rang

definitions.definition: be filled or permeated with (a particular quality).
examples: a clever retort which rang with contempt

definitions.definition: convey a specified impression or quality.
